newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling stronger against the dollar.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling stronger against the dollar.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling strengthened against the dollar on Friday in an active market, dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a shilling mean rate of 56.54 against the dollar from 56.77 on Thursday. Against the pound, it was posted at an average 87.68 from 88.00 on Thursday.
"The shilling continued its bullish tone with further gains against the dollar in the face of exporter sales," a dealer said.
"Players disposed of any dollars, trying hard to stay short as the central bank maintained a wait-and-see stand," she said.
"The market opened at 56.70/80 and ended just shy of the 56.50 support level." another dealer added. "In absence of intervention we could see the market move even lower, possibly to the 56 region.
Dealers said that the overnight money market was tight. Rates were between 18 and 22 percent.
